member.summary: Options for the exporting module.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetLabels(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Labels)
member.summary: HTML labels that can be positioined anywhere in the chart area.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetLegend(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend)
member.summary: The legend is a box containing a symbol and name for each series item or point item in the chart.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetLoading(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading)
member.summary: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The "Loading..." text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetNavigation(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigation)
member.summary: A collection of options for buttons and menus appearing in the exporting module.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetNavigator(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator)
member.summary: The navigator is a small series below the main series, displaying a view of the entire data set. It provides tools to zoom in and out on parts of the data as well as panning across the dataset.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetPlotOptions(DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions)
member.summary: The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetRangeSelector(DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector)
member.summary: The range selector is a tool for selecting ranges to display within the chart. It provides buttons to select preconfigured ranges in the chart, like 1 day, 1 week, 1 month etc. It also provides input boxes where min and max dates can be manually input.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetScrollbar(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar)
member.summary: The scrollbar is a means of panning over the X axis of a chart.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetSeries(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series)
member.summary: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.name: M:DotNet.Highstock.Highstock.SetSeries(DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series[])
member.summary: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart
member.summary: Options regarding the chart area and plot area as well as general chart options.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.AlignTicks
member.summary: When using multiple axis, the ticks of two or more opposite axes will automatically be aligned by adding ticks to the axis or axes with the least ticks. This can be prevented by setting alignTicks to false. If the grid lines look messy, it's a good idea to hide them for the secondary axis by setting gridLineWidth to 0. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Animation
member.summary:
Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.
The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported: duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the outer chart area. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the outer chart border. Default: #4572A7

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the outer chart border. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.BorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the outer chart border. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.ClassName
member.summary: A CSS class name to apply to the charts container div, allowing unique CSS styling for each chart.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Events
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Height
member.summary: An explicit height for the chart. By default the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element, or 400 pixels if the containing element's height is 0.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.IgnoreHiddenSeries
member.summary: If true, the axes will scale to the remaining visible series once one series is hidden. If false, hiding and showing a series will not affect the axes or the other series. For stacks, once one series within the stack is hidden, the rest of the stack will close in around it even if the axis is not affected. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Inverted
member.summary: Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is vertical and y axis is horizontal. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar series is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Margin
member.summary:
The margin between the outer edge of the chart and the plot area. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft for shorthand setting of one option.
Since version 2.1, the margin is 0 by default. The actual space is dynamically calculated from the offset of axis labels, axis title, title, subtitle and legend in addition to the spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options. Defaults to [null].

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.MarginBottom
member.summary: The margin between the bottom outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingBottom.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.MarginLeft
member.summary: The margin between the left outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingLeft.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.MarginRight
member.summary: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.MarginTop
member.summary: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Options3d
member.summary: Options to render charts in 3 dimensions. This feature requires highstock-3d.js, found in the download package or online at code.highstock.com/highstock-3d.js.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PanKey
member.summary: Allows setting a key to switch between zooming and panning.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Panning
member.summary: Allow panning in a chart. Best used with panKey to combine zooming and panning. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PinchType
member.summary: Equivalent to zoomType, but for multitouch gestures only. By default, the pinchType is the same as the zoomType setting. However, pinching can be enabled separately in some cases, for example in stock charts where a mouse drag pans the chart, while pinching is enabled. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PlotBackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the plot area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PlotBackgroundImage
member.summary: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PlotBorderColor
member.summary: The color of the inner chart or plot area border. Default: #C0C0C0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PlotBorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the plot area border. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.PlotShadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Polar
member.summary: When true, cartesian charts like line, spline, area and column are transformed into the polar coordinate system. Requires highstock-more.js. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Reflow
member.summary: Whether to reflow the chart to fit the width of the container div on resizing the window. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.ResetZoomButton
member.summary: The button that appears after a selection zoom, allowing the user to reset zoom.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.SelectionMarkerFill
member.summary: The background color of the marker square when selecting (zooming in on) an area of the chart. Default: rgba(69,114,167,0.25)

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.ShowAxes
member.summary: Whether to show the axes initially. This only applies to empty charts where series are added dynamically, as axes are automatically added to cartesian series. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Spacing
member.summary: The distance between the outer edge of the chart and the content, like title, legend, axis title or labels. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options for shorthand setting of one option. Default: [10, 10, 15, 10]

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.SpacingBottom
member.summary: The space between the bottom edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). Default: 15

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.SpacingLeft
member.summary: The space between the left edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.SpacingRight
member.summary: The space between the right edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.SpacingTop
member.summary: The space between the top edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Style
member.summary: Additional CSS styles to apply inline to the container div. Note that since the default font styles are applied in the renderer, it is ignorant of the individual chart options and must be set globally. Defaults to:style: { fontFamily: ''Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif', // default font fontSize: '12px'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Type
member.summary: The default series type for the chart. Can be any of the chart types listed under plotOptions. Default: line

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.Width
member.summary: An explicit width for the chart. By default the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Chart.ZoomType
member.summary: Decides in what dimensions the user can zoom by dragging the mouse. Can be one of x, y or xy.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartEvents
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartEvents.AddSeries
member.summary: Fires when a series is added to the chart after load time, using the addSeries method. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock. Through event.options you can access the series options that was passed to the addSeries method. Returning false prevents the series from being added.

summary.p: Fires when clicking on the plot background. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

Information on the clicked spot can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' value at the clicked spot. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.
summary.pre: click: function(e) { console.log( Highstock.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', e.xAxis[0].value), e.yAxis[0].value )}

summary.p: Fires when a drilldown point is clicked, before the new series is added. Event arguments include point for the originating point, and seriesOptions for the new series.
This event is also utilized for async drilldown, where the seriesOptions are not added by option, but rather loaded async.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartEvents.Drillup
member.summary: Fires when drilling up from a drilldown series.

summary.p: Fires when the chart is finished loading. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.
From version 2.0.4, there is also a second parameter to Highstock.Chart where a callback function can be passed to be executed on chart.load.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartEvents.Redraw
member.summary: Fires when the chart is redrawn, either after a call to chart.redraw() or after an axis, series or point is modified with the redraw option set to true. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

summary.p: Fires when an area of the chart has been selected. Selection is enabled by setting the chart's zoomType. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock. The default action for the selection event is to zoom the chart to the selected area. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault().

Information on the selected area can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' min and max values. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.
summary.pre: selection: function(event) { // log the min and max of the primary, datetime x-axis console.log( Highstock.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].min), Highstock.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].max) ); // log the min and max of the y axis console.log(event.yAxis[0].min, event.yAxis[0].max);}

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d
member.summary: Options to render charts in 3 dimensions. This feature requires highstock-3d.js, found in the download package or online at code.highstock.com/highstock-3d.js.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.Alpha
member.summary: One of the two rotation angles for the chart. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.Beta
member.summary: One of the two rotation angles for the chart. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.Depth
member.summary: The total depth of the chart. Default: 100

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.Enabled
member.summary: Wether to render the chart using the 3D functionality. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.Frame
member.summary: Provides the option to draw a frame around the charts by defining a bottom, front and back panel.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3d.ViewDistance
member.summary: Defines the distance the viewer is standing in front of the chart, this setting is important to calculate the perspective effect in column and scatter charts.It is not used for 3D pie charts. Default: 100

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3dFrame
member.summary: Provides the option to draw a frame around the charts by defining a bottom, front and back panel.

member.summary: Defines the back panel of the frame around 3D charts.

member.summary: The bottom of the frame around a 3D chart.

member.summary: The side for the frame around a 3D chart.

member.summary: The color of the panel. Default: transparent

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartOptions3dFrameBack.Size
member.summary: Thickness of the panel. Default: 1

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartResetZoomButton
member.summary: The button that appears after a selection zoom, allowing the user to reset zoom.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartResetZoomButton.Position
member.summary: The position of the button. This is an object that can hold the properties align, verticalAlign, x and y.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartResetZoomButton.RelativeTo
member.summary: What frame the button should be placed related to. Can be either 'plot' or 'chart'. Default: plot

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ChartResetZoomButton.Theme
member.summary: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Colors
member.summary:
An array containing the default colors for the chart's series. When all colors are used, new colors are pulled from the start again. Defaults to:colors: ['#7cb5ec', '#434348', '#90ed7d', '#f7a35c', '#8085e9', '#f15c80', '#e4d354', '#8085e8', '#8d4653', '#91e8e1']Default colors can also be set on a series or series.type basis, see column.colors, pie.colors.
Legacy
In Highstock 3.x, the default colors were:colors: ['#2f7ed8', '#0d233a', '#8bbc21', '#910000', '#1aadce', '#492970', '#f28f43', '#77a1e5', '#c42525', '#a6c96a']
In Highstock 2.x, the default colors were:colors: ['#4572A7', '#AA4643', '#89A54E', '#80699B', '#3D96AE', '#DB843D', '#92A8CD', '#A47D7C', '#B5CA92'] Default: [ '#7cb5ec' , '#434348' , '#90ed7d' , '#f7a35c' , '#8085e9' , '#f15c80' , '#e4d354' , '#8085e8' , '#8d4653' , '#91e8e1']

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits
member.summary: Highchart by default puts a credits label in the lower right corner of the chart. This can be changed using these options.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to show the credits text. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits.Href
member.summary: The URL for the credits label. Default: http://www.highstock.com

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits.Position
member.summary: Position configuration for the credits label. Supported properties are align, verticalAlign, x and y. Defaults to position: { align: 'right', x: -10, verticalAlign: 'bottom', y: -5}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the credits label. Defaults to:style: { cursor: 'pointer', color: '#909090', fontSize: '10px'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Credits.Text
member.summary: The text for the credits label. Default: Highstock.com

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting
member.summary: Options for the exporting module. For an overview on the matter, see the docs.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Buttons
member.summary: Options for the export related buttons, print and export. In addition to the default buttons listed here, custom buttons can be added. See navigation.buttonOptions for general options.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.ChartOptions
member.summary: Additional chart options to be merged into an exported chart. For example, the exported chart can be given a specific width and height, or a printer-friendly color scheme. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to enable the exporting module. Disabling the module will hide the context button, but API methods will still be available. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Filename
member.summary: The filename, without extension, to use for the exported chart. Default: chart

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.FormAttributes
member.summary: An object containing additional attributes for the POST form that sends the SVG to the export server. For example, a target can be set to make sure the generated image is received in another frame, or a custom enctype or encoding can be set.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Scale
member.summary: Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.SourceHeight
member.summary: Analogous to sourceWidth

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.SourceWidth
member.summary: The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Type
member.summary: Default MIME type for exporting if chart.exportChart() is called without specifying a type option. Possible values are image/png, image/jpeg, application/pdf and image/svg+xml. Default: image/png

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Url
member.summary: The URL for the server module converting the SVG string to an image format. By default this points to Highslide Software's free web service. Default: http://export.highstock.com

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Exporting.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. As of Highstock 3.0, the default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale. Default: undefined

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtons
member.summary: Options for the export related buttons, print and export. In addition to the default buttons listed here, custom buttons can be added. See navigation.buttonOptions for general options.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtons.ContextButton
member.summary: Options for the export button.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton
member.summary: Options for the export button.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Align
member.summary: Alignment for the buttons. Default: right

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to enable buttons. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Height
member.summary: Pixel height of the buttons. Default: 20

summary.p: A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click.

By default, there is the 'Print' menu item plus one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Onclick
member.summary: A click handler callback to use on the button directly instead of the popup menu.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol for the button. Points to a definition function in the Highstock.Renderer.symbols collection. The default exportIcon function is part of the exporting module. Default: menu

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => symbolFill. Default: #A8BF77

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolSize
member.summary: The pixel size of the symbol on the button. Default: 14

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolStroke
member.summary: The color of the symbol's stroke or line. Default: #666

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolStrokeWidth
member.summary: The pixel stroke width of the symbol on the button. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolX
member.summary: The x position of the center of the symbol inside the button. Default: 12.5

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolY
member.summary: The y position of the center of the symbol inside the button. Default: 10.5

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Text
member.summary: A text string to add to the individual button. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Theme
member.summary: A configuration object for the button theme. The object accepts SVG properties like stroke-width, stroke and fill. Tri-state button styles are supported by the states.hover and states.select objects.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the buttons. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'. Default: top

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of the button. Default: 24

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.X
member.summary: The horizontal position of the button relative to the align option. Default: -10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the button's position relative to its verticalAlign. . Default: 0

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton
member.summary: Options for the export button.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.HoverSymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => hoverSymbolFill. Defaults to #768F3E

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.Onclick
member.summary: A click handler callback to use on the button directly instead of the popup menu.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.MenuItems
member.summary: A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click. By default, there is one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol for the button. Points to a definition function in the Highstock.Renderer.symbols collection. The default exportIcon function is part of the exporting module. Defaults to "exportIcon"

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.SymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => symbolFill. Defaults to #A8BF77

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsExportButton.X
member.summary: The horizontal positioin of the button relative to the align option. Defaults to 10

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton
member.summary: Options for the print button.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton.HoverSymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => hoverSymbolFill. Defaults to #779ABF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton.Onclick
member.summary: A click handler callback to use on the button directly. By default this onclick calls chart.print(), but it can be overridden to do other actions.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol for the button. Points to a definition function in the Highstock.Renderer.symbols collection. The default print function is part of the exporting module. Defaults to "printIcon"

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton.SymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => symbolFill. Defaults to #B5C9DF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ExportingButtonsPrintButton.X
member.summary: The horizontal positioin of the button relative to the align option. Defaults to -36

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Global
member.summary: Global options that don't apply to each chart. These options, like the lang options, must be set using the Highstock.setOptions method.Highstock.setOptions({ global: { useUTC: false }});

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Global.VMLRadialGradientURL
member.summary: Path to the pattern image required by VML browsers in order to draw radial gradients. Default: http://code.highstock.com/{version}/gfx/vml-radial-gradient.png

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Global.TimezoneOffset
member.summary: The timezone offset in minutes. Positive values are west, negative values are east of UTC, as in the ECMAScript getTimezoneOffset method. Use this to display UTC based data in a predefined time zone. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Global.UseUTC
member.summary: Whether to use UTC time for axis scaling, tickmark placement and time display in Highstock.dateFormat. Advantages of using UTC is that the time displays equally regardless of the user agent's time zone settings. Local time can be used when the data is loaded in real time or when correct Daylight Saving Time transitions are required. Default: true

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Labels
member.summary: HTML labels that can be positioned anywhere in the chart area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Labels.Items
member.summary: A HTML label that can be positioned anywhere in the chart area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Labels.Style
member.summary: Shared CSS styles for all labels. Defaults to:style: { color: '#3E576F'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ButtonsItems.Type
member.summary: Defines the timespan, can be one of 'millisecond', 'second', 'minute', 'day', 'week', 'month', 'ytd' (year to date), 'year' and 'all'.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ButtonsItems.Count
member.summary: Defines how many units of the defined type to use.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.ButtonsItems.Text
member.summary: The text for the button itself

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LabelsItems
member.summary: A HTML label that can be positioned anywhere in the chart area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LabelsItems.Html
member.summary: Inner HTML or text for the label.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LabelsItems.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for each label. To position the label, use left and top like this:style: { left: '100px', top: '100px'}

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang
member.summary: Language object. The language object is global and it can't be set on each chart initiation. Instead, use Highstock.setOptions to set it before any chart is initiated. Highstock.setOptions({ lang: { months: ['Janvier', 'Fvrier', 'Mars', 'Avril', 'Mai', 'Juin', 'Juillet', 'Aot', 'Septembre', 'Octobre', 'Novembre', 'Dcembre'], weekdays: ['Dimanche', 'Lundi', 'Mardi', 'Mercredi', 'Jeudi', 'Vendredi', 'Samedi'] }});

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.ContextButtonTitle
member.summary: Exporting module menu. The tooltip title for the context menu holding print and export menu items. Default: Chart context menu

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.DecimalPoint
member.summary: The default decimal point used in the Highstock.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Default: .

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.DownloadJPEG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the JPEG download menu item. Default: Download JPEG image

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.DownloadPDF
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the PDF download menu item. Default: Download PDF document

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.DownloadPNG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the PNG download menu item. Default: Download PNG image

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.DownloadSVG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the SVG download menu item. Default: Download SVG vector image

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.Loading
member.summary: The loading text that appears when the chart is set into the loading state following a call to chart.showLoading. Default: Loading...

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.Months
member.summary: An array containing the months names. Corresponds to the %B format in Highstock.dateFormat(). Default: [ "January" , "February" , "March" , "April" , "May" , "June" , "July" , "August" , "September" , "October" , "November" , "December"]

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.NumericSymbols
member.summary: Metric prefixes used to shorten high numbers in axis labels. Replacing any of the positions with null causes the full number to be written. Setting numericSymbols to null disables shortening altogether. Default: [ "k" , "M" , "G" , "T" , "P" , "E"]

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.PrintChart
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to print the chart. Default: Print chart

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.RangeSelectorFrom
member.summary: The text for the label for the "from" input box in the range selector. Defaults to From.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.RangeSelectorTo
member.summary: The text for the label for the "to" input box in the range selector. Defaults to To.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.RangeSelectorZoom
member.summary: The text for the label for the range selector buttons. Defaults to Zoom.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.ResetZoom
member.summary: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed. Default: Reset zoom

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.ResetZoomTitle
member.summary: The tooltip title for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed. Default: Reset zoom level 1:1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.ShortMonths
member.summary: An array containing the months names in abbreviated form. Corresponds to the %b format in Highstock.dateFormat(). Default: [ "Jan" , "Feb" , "Mar" , "Apr" , "May" , "Jun" , "Jul" , "Aug" , "Sep" , "Oct" , "Nov" , "Dec"]

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.ThousandsSep
member.summary: The default thousands separator used in the Highstock.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Default: ,

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Lang.Weekdays
member.summary: An array containing the weekday names. Default: ["Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday"]

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend
member.summary: The legend is a box containing a symbol and name for each series item or point item in the chart.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the legend box within the chart area. Valid values are 'left', 'center' and 'right'. Default: center

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color of the legend.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the drawn border around the legend. Default: #909090

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border corner radius of the legend. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the drawn border around the legend. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the legend. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Floating
member.summary: When the legend is floating, the plot area ignores it and is allowed to be placed below it. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemDistance
member.summary: In a legend with horizontal layout, the itemDistance defines the pixel distance between each item. Default: 20

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemHiddenStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for each legend item when the corresponding series or point is hidden. Only a subset of CSS is supported, notably those options related to text. Properties are inherited from style unless overridden here. Defaults to:itemHiddenStyle: { color: '#CCC'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemHoverStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for each legend item in hover mode. Only a subset of CSS is supported, notably those options related to text. Properties are inherited from style unless overridden here. Defaults to:itemHoverStyle: { color: '#000'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemMarginBottom
member.summary: The pixel bottom margin for each legend item. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemMarginTop
member.summary: The pixel top margin for each legend item. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for each legend item. Only a subset of CSS is supported, notably those options related to text. Default: { "color": "#333333", "cursor": "pointer", "fontSize": "12px", "fontWeight": "bold" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.ItemWidth
member.summary: The width for each legend item. This is useful in a horizontal layout with many items when you want the items to align vertically. .

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.LabelFormat
member.summary: A format string for each legend label. Available variables relates to properties on the series, or the point in case of pies. Default: {name}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.LabelFormatter
member.summary: Callback function to format each of the series' labels. The this keyword refers to the series object, or the point object in case of pie charts. By default the series or point name is printed.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Layout
member.summary: The layout of the legend items. Can be one of 'horizontal' or 'vertical'. Default: horizontal

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.LineHeight
member.summary: Line height for the legend items. Deprecated as of 2.1. Instead, the line height for each item can be set using itemStyle.lineHeight, and the padding between items using itemMarginTop and itemMarginBottom. Default: 16

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Margin
member.summary: If the plot area sized is calculated automatically and the legend is not floating, the legend margin is the space between the legend and the axis labels or plot area. Default: 15

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum pixel height for the legend. When the maximum height is extended, navigation will show.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Navigation
member.summary: Options for the paging or navigation appearing when the legend is overflown. When legend.useHTML is enabled, navigation is disabled.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Padding
member.summary: The inner padding of the legend box. Default: 8

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Rtl
member.summary: Whether to show the symbol on the right side of the text rather than the left side. This is common in Arabic and Hebraic. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.SymbolHeight
member.summary: The pixel height of the symbol for series types that use a rectangle in the legend. Default: 12

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.SymbolPadding
member.summary: The pixel padding between the legend item symbol and the legend item text. Default: 5

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.SymbolRadius
member.summary: The border radius of the symbol for series types that use a rectangle in the legend. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.SymbolWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the legend item symbol. Default: 16

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Title
member.summary: A title to be added on top of the legend.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the legend item texts. When using HTML, legend.navigation is disabled. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the legend box. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'. Vertical position can be further determined by the y option. Default: bottom

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Width
member.summary: The width of the legend box.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.X
member.summary: The x offset of the legend relative to its horizontal alignment align within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Negative x moves it to the left, positive x moves it to the right. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Legend.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the legend relative to it's vertical alignment verticalAlign within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Negative y moves it up, positive y moves it down. Default: 0

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation
member.summary: Options for the paging or navigation appearing when the legend is overflown. When legend.useHTML is enabled, navigation is disabled.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation.ActiveColor
member.summary: The color for the active up or down arrow in the legend page navigation. Default: #3E576F

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation.Animation
member.summary: How to animate the pages when navigating up or down. A value of true applies the default navigation given in the chart.animation option. Additional options can be given as an object containing values for easing and duration. . Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation.ArrowSize
member.summary: The pixel size of the up and down arrows in the legend paging navigation. . Default: 12

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation.InactiveColor
member.summary: The color of the inactive up or down arrow in the legend page navigation. . Default: #CCC

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendNavigation.Style
member.summary: Text styles for the legend page navigation.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendTitle
member.summary: A title to be added on top of the legend.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendTitle.Style
member.summary: Generic CSS styles for the legend title. Defaults to:style: { fontWeight: 'bold'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.LegendTitle.Text
member.summary: A text or HTML string for the title. Default: null

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator
member.summary: The navigator is a small series below the main series, displaying a view of the entire data set. It provides tools to zoom in and out on parts of the data as well as panning across the dataset.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.AdaptToUpdatedData
member.summary: Whether the navigator and scrollbar should adapt to updated data in the base X axis. This should be false when loading data asynchronously, to prevent circular loading. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.BaseSeries
member.summary: An integer identifying the index to use for the base series, or a string representing the id of the series. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the navigator. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.Handles
member.summary: Options for the handles for dragging the zoomed area. Available options are backgroundColor (defaults to #ebe7e8) and borderColor defaults to #b2b1b6

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.Height
member.summary: The height of the navigator. Defaults to 40.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.Margin
member.summary: The distance from the nearest element, the X axis or X axis labels. Defaults to 25.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.MaskFill
member.summary: The color of the mask covering the areas of the navigator series that are currently not visible in the main series. The default color is bluish with an opacity of 0.3 to see the series below. Defaults to rgba(128,179,236,0.3).

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.MaskInside
member.summary: Whether the mask should be inside the range marking the zoomed range, or outside. In Highstock 1.x it was always false. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.OutlineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the currently zoomed area in the navigator. Defaults to #b2b1b6.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigator.OutlineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the currently zoomed area in the navigator. Defaults to 2.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar

member.summary: The background color of the scrollbar itself. Defaults to #bfc8d1.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.BarBorderColor
member.summary: The color of the scrollbar's border. Defaults to #bfc8d1.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.BarBorderRadius
member.summary: The border rounding radius of the bar. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.BarBorderWidth

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.ButtonBackgroundColor
member.summary: The color of scrollbar buttons. Defaults to #ebe7e8.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.ButtonBorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border of the scrollbar buttons. Defaults to #bbbbbb.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.ButtonBorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the scrollbar buttons. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.ButtonBorderWidth
member.summary: The border width of the scrollbar buttons. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the scrollbar. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.Height
member.summary: The height of the scrollbar. The height also applies to the width of the scroll arrows so that they are always squares. Defaults to 20 for touch devices and 14 for mouse devices.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Scrollbar.LiveRedraw
member.summary: Whether to redraw the main chart as the scrollbar or the navigator zoomed window is moved. Defaults to true for modern browsers and false for legacy IE browsers as well as mobile devices.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector
member.summary: The range selector is a tool for selecting ranges to display within the chart. It provides buttons to select preconfigured ranges in the chart, like 1 day, 1 week, 1 month etc. It also provides input boxes where min and max dates can be manually input.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.AllButtonsEnabled
member.summary: Whether to enable all buttons from the start. By default buttons are only enabled if the corresponding time range exists on the X axis, but enabling all buttons allows for dynamically loading different time ranges. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.ButtonSpacing
member.summary: The space in pixels between the buttons in the range selector. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.ButtonTheme

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.Buttons
P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the range selector. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputBoxBorderColor
member.summary: The border color of the date input boxes. Defaults to silver.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputBoxHeight
member.summary: The pixel height of the date input boxes. Defaults to 17.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputBoxStyle

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputBoxWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the date input boxes. Defaults to 90.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputDateParser
member.summary: A custom callback function to parse values entered in the input boxes and return a valid JavaScript time as milliseconds since 1970.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputEditDateFormat

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputEnabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the date input boxes.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputPosition
member.summary: Positioning for the input boxes. Allowed properties are align, verticalAlign, x and y. Defaults to { align: "right" }.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.InputStyle
member.summary: CSS for the HTML inputs in the range selector.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.LabelStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for the labels - the Zoom, From and To texts.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.RangeSelector.Selected
member.summary: The index of the button to appear pre-selected. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading
member.summary: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The 'Loading...' text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading.HideDuration
member.summary: The duration in milliseconds of the fade out effect. Default: 100

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading.LabelStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for the loading label span. Default: { "fontWeight": "bold", "position": "relative", "top": "45%" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading.ShowDuration
member.summary: The duration in milliseconds of the fade in effect. Default: 100

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Loading.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the loading screen that covers the plot area. Defaults to:style: { position: 'absolute', backgroundColor: 'white', opacity: 0.5, textAlign: 'center'}

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Navigation

member.summary: CSS styles for the popup menu appearing by default when the export icon is clicked. This menu is rendered in HTML. Defaults to menuStyle: { border: '1px solid #A0A0A0', background: '#FFFFFF'}

summary.p: The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array.

Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Arearange
member.summary: The area range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highstock-more.js.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Areasplinerange
member.summary: The area spline range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highstock-more.js.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Boxplot
member.summary: A box plot is a convenient way of depicting groups of data through their five-number summaries: the smallest observation (sample minimum), lower quartile (Q1), median (Q2), upper quartile (Q3), and largest observation (sample maximum).

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Bubble
member.summary: A bubble series is a three dimensional series type where each point renders an X, Y and Z value. Each points is drawn as a bubble where the position along the X and Y axes mark the X and Y values, and the size of the bubble relates to the Z value.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Columnrange
member.summary: The column range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highstock-more.js. To display horizontal bars, set chart.inverted to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Errorbar
member.summary: Error bars are a graphical representation of the variability of data and are used on graphs to indicate the error, or uncertainty in a reported measurement.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Funnel
member.summary: Funnel charts are a type of chart often used to visualize stages in a sales project, where the top are the initial stages with the most clients. It requires that the modules/funnel.js file is loaded.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Gauge
member.summary: General plotting options for the gauge series type. Requires highstock-more.js

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Heatmap
member.summary: The heatmap series type. This series type is available both in Highstock and Highmaps. See the Highmaps API for details.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Pie
member.summary: A pie chart is a circular chart divided into sectors, illustrating numerical proportion.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Pyramid
member.summary: A pyramid chart consists of a single pyramid with item heights corresponding to each point value. Technically it is the same as a reversed funnel chart without a neck.

summary.p: General options for all series types.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Solidgauge
member.summary: A gauge showing values using a filled arc with colors indicating the value. The solid gauge plots values against the yAxis, which is extended with some color options, minColor, maxColor and stops, to control the color of the gauge itself.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptions.Waterfall
member.summary: Options for the waterfall series type.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Animation
member.summary:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported: duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds.easingWhen using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear orswing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notablythe jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.
Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Color
member.summary: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.ConnectEnds
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.ConnectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Default: 300

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to 'pointer' if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.DashStyle
member.summary:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
Solid
ShortDash
ShortDot
ShortDashDot
ShortDashDotDot
Dot
Dash
LongDash
DashDot
LongDashDot
LongDashDotDot Default: Solid

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.FillColor
member.summary: Fill color or gradient for the area. When null, the series' color is used with the series' fillOpacity.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.FillOpacity
member.summary: Fill opacity for the area. Default: 0.75

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.LineColor
member.summary: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ':previous' to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.NegativeFillColor
member.summary: A separate color for the negative part of the area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.PointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, 'normal' to stack by value or 'percent'.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the area behaves like a line series with fill between the graph and the Y axis minimum. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.TrackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable. Default: 1000

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsArea.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of 'left', 'center' or 'right'. Default: center

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter. Default: {y}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to 'none'. Default: justify

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds and borders will be lost on a rotated data label. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point. Default: -6

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series. Default: 6

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked.. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. Default: 4

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are 'circle', 'square', 'diamond', 'triangle' and 'triangle-down'.
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: 'url(graphic.png)'. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highstock.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStates.Select
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for a hovered point. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsAreaMarkerStatesHover.RadiusPlus
member.summary: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point. Default: 2

member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.summary: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection. Default: true

member.summary: The fill color of the point marker.

member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #000000

member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2.

member.summary: Properties for each single point
