Fires when a point is clicked. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStates
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHover.Brightness
member.summary: How much to brighten the point on interaction. Requires the main color to be defined in hex or rgb(a) format. Default: 0.1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend.. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHover.Halo
member.summary: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverHalo
member.summary: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highstock is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats. Default: 0.25

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble. Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallStatesHoverMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. Default: 4

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are 'circle', 'square', 'diamond', 'triangle' and 'triangle-down'.
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: 'url(graphic.png)'. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highstock.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L', second:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S', minute:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M', hour:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M', day:'%A, %b %e, %Y', week:'Week from %A, %b %e, %Y', month:'%B %Y', year:'%Y'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.FollowPointer
member.summary:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. The default value of false causes a touch move to scroll the web page, as is default behaviour on touch devices. Setting it to true may cause the user to be trapped inside the chart and unable to scroll away, so it should be used with care. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format. Default: false

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart. Default: 500

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.PointFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units. Default: \u25CF {series.name}: {point.y}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highstock 3.x and less, the shape was square. Default: callout

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.PlotOptionsWaterfallTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series
member.summary: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Data
member.summary:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways:
An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example:data: [0, 5, 3, 5]
An array of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.
For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange. Example:data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]]
An array of objects with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.
Range series values are given by low and high.Example:data: [{ name: 'Point 1', color: '#00FF00', y: 0}, { name: 'Point 2', color: '#FF00FF', y: 5}]
Note that line series and derived types like spline and area, require data to be sorted by X because it interpolates mouse coordinates for the tooltip. Column and scatter series, where each point has its own mouse event, does not require sorting.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Stack
member.summary: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highstock-more.js component.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Series.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesData
member.summary:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways:
An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example:data: [0, 5, 3, 5]
An array of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.
For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange. Example:data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]]
An array of objects with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.
Range series values are given by low and high.Example:data: [{ name: 'Point 1', color: '#00FF00', y: 0}, { name: 'Point 2', color: '#FF00FF', y: 5}]
Note that line series and derived types like spline and area, require data to be sorted by X because it interpolates mouse coordinates for the tooltip. Column and scatter series, where each point has its own mouse event, does not require sorting.

member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. Default: 4

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are 'circle', 'square', 'diamond', 'triangle' and 'triangle-down'.
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: 'url(graphic.png)'. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highstock.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStates.Select
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #FFFFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for a hovered point. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesHover.RadiusPlus
member.summary: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point. Default: 2

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used. Default: #000000

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.SeriesDataMarkerStatesSelect.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle
member.summary: The chart's subtitle

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the subtitle. Can be one of 'left', 'center' and 'right'. Default: center

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.Floating
member.summary: When the subtitle is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the title. Exact positioning of the title can be achieved by changing the margin property, or by adding position: 'absolute' and left and top properties. Default: { "color": "#555555" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.Text
member.summary: The subtitle of the chart.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the text. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' and 'bottom'. When a value is given, the title behaves as floating. Default:

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.X
member.summary: The x position of the subtitle relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Subtitle.Y
member.summary: The y position of the subtitle relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. By default the subtitle is laid out below the title unless the title is floating. Default: null

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Symbols
member.summary: An array containing the default symbols for the series point markers. When all symbols are used, new symbols are pulled from the start again. Defaults to: symbols: [ 'circle', 'diamond', 'square', 'triangle', 'triangle-down' ]

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title
member.summary: The chart's main title.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the title. Can be one of 'left', 'center' and 'right'. Default: center

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Floating
member.summary: When the title is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Margin
member.summary: The margin between the title and the plot area, or if a subtitle is present, the margin between the subtitle and the plot area. Default: 15

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the title. Use this for font styling, but use align, x and y for text alignment. Default: { "color": "#333333", "fontSize": "18px" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Text
member.summary: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null. Default: Chart title

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.UseHTML

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' and 'bottom'. When a value is given, the title behaves as floating. Default:

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.X
member.summary: The x position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Title.Y
member.summary: The y position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. By default it depends on the font size.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip
member.summary: Options for the tooltip that appears when the user hovers over a series or point.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Animation
member.summary: Enable or disable animation of the tooltip. In slow legacy IE browsers the animation is disabled by default. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the tooltip. Default: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.85)

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.BorderRadius
member.summary: The radius of the rounded border corners. Default: 3

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.BorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the tooltip border. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Crosshairs
member.summary: Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object. Boolean If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown. Array of booleans In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs. Array of objects In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given. Defaults to null.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L', second:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S', minute:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M', hour:'%A, %b %e, %H:%M', day:'%A, %b %e, %Y', week:'Week from %A, %b %e, %Y', month:'%B %Y', year:'%Y'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the tooltip. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.FollowPointer
member.summary:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. The default value of false causes a touch move to scroll the web page, as is default behaviour on touch devices. Setting it to true may cause the user to be trapped inside the chart and unable to scroll away, so it should be used with care. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format. Default: false

summary.p: Callback function to format the text of the tooltip. Return false to disable tooltip for a specific point on series.

A subset of HTML is supported. The HTML of the tooltip is parsed and converted to SVG, therefore this isn't a complete HTML renderer. The following tabs are supported: , , , ,
, . Spans can be styled with a style attribute, but only text-related CSS that is shared with SVG is handled.

Since version 2.1 the tooltip can be shared between multiple series through the shared option. The available data in the formatter differ a bit depending on whether the tooltip is shared or not. In a shared tooltip, all properties except x, which is common for all points, are kept in an array, this.points.
Available data are:

dl.dd: Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
In a shared tooltip, this is an array containing all other properties for each point.
The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
The x value. This property is the same regardless of the tooltip being shared or not.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart. Default: 500

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.PointFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units. Default: \u25CF {series.name}: {point.y}

summary.p: A callback function to place the tooltip in a default position. The callback receives three parameters: labelWidth, labelHeight and point, where point contains values for plotX and plotY telling where the reference point is in the plot area. Add chart.plotLeft and chart.plotTop to get the full coordinates.
The return should be an object containing x and y values, for example { x: 100, y: 100 }.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the tooltip. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highstock 3.x and less, the shape was square. Default: callout

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Shared
member.summary: When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement or touch events. Tooltip texts for series types with ordered data (not pie, scatter, flags etc) will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for tablet/mobile optimized charts. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Snap
member.summary: Proximity snap for graphs or single points. Does not apply to bars, columns and pie slices. It defaults to 10 for mouse-powered devices and 25 for touch devices.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the tooltip. The tooltip can also be styled through the CSS class .highstock-tooltip. Default value:style: { color: '#333333', fontSize: '12px', padding: '8px'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.UseHTML
member.summary: Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.Tooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

summary.p: The X axis or category axis. Normally this is the horizontal axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the vertical axis. In case of multiple axes, the xAxis node is an array of configuration objects.
See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

summary.p: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highstock 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to 'category'.
Example:categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to:{ millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L', second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Events
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.GridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Default: #C0C0C0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Default: Solid

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Labels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Default: #C0D0E0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored. Default: 0.01

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored. Default: 0.01

summary.p: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.
The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.
On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorGridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Default: #E0E0E0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Default: Solid

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorGridLineWidth
member.summary: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks. Default: #A0A0A0

summary.p: Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if 'auto', the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of 'auto' on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.
On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Default: outside

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Default: false

summary.p: An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.
In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.PlotLines
member.summary: An array of lines stretching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickColor
member.summary: Color for the main tick marks. Default: #C0D0E0

summary.p: The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 forthe X axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Default: outside

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If 'on' the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if 'between' the tick mark is placed between categories. Default: between

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Title
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxis.Type
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of 'linear', 'logarithmic', 'datetime' or 'category'. In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined. Default: linear

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisEvents
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisEvents.AfterSetExtremes
member.summary: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

summary.p: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. The this keyword refers to the axis object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the 'Reset zoom' button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of 'left', 'center' or 'right'. Defaults to an intelligent guess based on which side of the chart the axis is on and the rotation of the label. Default: center

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Distance
member.summary: Polar charts only. The label's pixel distance from the perimeter of the plot area. Default: 15

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the axis label. Default: {value}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. Defaults to: function() { return this.value;}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.MaxStaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axis only. When staggerLines is not set, maxStaggerLines defines how many lines the axis is allowed to add to automatically avoid overlapping X labels. Set to 1 to disable overlap detection. Default: 5

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined, false or 'justify'. By default it aligns inside the chart area. If 'justify', labels will not render outside the plot area. If false, it will not be aligned at all. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.StaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. .

summary.p: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Defaults to:style: { color: '#6D869F', fontWeight: 'bold'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index for the axis labels. Default: 7

summary.p: An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.
In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Align
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are 'low', 'middle' or 'high'. Default: middle

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable. Default: { "color": "#707070", "fontWeight": "bold" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.XAxisTitle.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. It can contain basic HTML text markup like <b>, <i> and spans with style.

summary.p: The Y axis or value axis. Normally this is the vertical axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the horizontal axis. In case of multiple axes, the yAxis node is an array of configuration objects.
See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

summary.p: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highstock 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to 'category'.
Example:categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to:{ millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L', second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.GridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Default: #C0C0C0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Default: Solid

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.GridLineInterpolation
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether the grid lines should draw as a polygon with straight lines between categories, or as circles. Can be either circle or polygon. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Default: #C0D0E0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MaxColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the maximum value of the Y axis. Default: #102D4C

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. Default: 0.05

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the minimum value of the Y axis. Default: #EFEFFF

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. Default: 0.05

summary.p: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.
The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.
On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorGridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Default: #E0E0E0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Default: Solid

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorGridLineWidth
member.summary: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks. Default: #A0A0A0

summary.p: Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if 'auto', the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of 'auto' on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.
On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Default: 2

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Default: outside

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.ReversedStacks
member.summary: If true, the first series in a stack will be drawn on top in a positive, non-reversed Y axis. If false, the first series is in the base of the stack. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.StackLabels
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Default: 1

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Default: true

summary.p: Solid gauge series only. Color stops for the solid gauge. Use this in cases where a linear gradient between a minColor and maxColor is not sufficient. The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.
For solid gauges, the Y axis also inherits the concept of data classes from the Highmaps color axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickColor
member.summary: Color for the main tick marks. Default: #C0D0E0

summary.p: The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 forthe X axis.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Default: outside

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If 'on' the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if 'between' the tick mark is placed between categories. Default: between

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Type
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of 'linear', 'logarithmic', 'datetime' or 'category'. In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined. Default: linear

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Height
member.summary: The height of the Y axis. If it's a number, it is interpreted as pixels. Since Highstock 2: If it's a percentage string, it is interpreted as percentages of the total plot height. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxis.Top
member.summary: The top position of the Y axis. If it's a number, it is interpreted as pixel position relative to the chart. Since Highstock 2: If it's a percentage string, it is interpreted as percentages of the plot height, offset from plot area top. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisEvents.AfterSetExtremes
member.summary: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

summary.p: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. The this keyword refers to the axis object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highstock.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the 'Reset zoom' button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisLabels.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of 'left', 'center' or 'right'. Default: right

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels. Default: true

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the axis label. Default: {value}

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

member.summary: CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Defaults to:style: { color: '#6D869F', fontWeight: 'bold'}

member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisLabels.X

member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Default: 3

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisLabels.Distance
member.summary: The distance of the data label from the pie's edge. Negative numbers put the data label on top of the pie slices. Connectors are only shown for data labels outside the pie. Default: 30

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.Color
member.summary: The color of the plot band.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.Events
member.summary: An object defining mouse events for the plot band. Supported properties are click, mouseover, mouseout, mousemove.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.From
member.summary: The start position of the plot band in axis units.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.Id
member.summary: An id used for identifying the plot band in Axis.removePlotBand.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.InnerRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the inner radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like '100%', or as a pixel number, like 100. By default, the inner radius is controlled by the thickness option. Default: null

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.Label
member.summary: Text labels for the plot bands

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.OuterRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the outer radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like '100%', or as a pixel number, like 100. Default: 100%

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.Thickness
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option sets the width of the plot band stretching along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like '10%', or as a pixel number, like 10. The default value 10 is the same as the default tickLength, thus making the plot band act as a background for the tick markers. Default: 10

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBands.To
member.summary: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

member.summary: Rotation of the text label in degrees . Default: 0

member.summary: CSS styles for the text label.

member.summary: The string text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBandsLabel.TextAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are 'left', 'center' and 'right'. Defaults to the same as the align option.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBandsLabel.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Vertical alignment of the label relative to the plot band. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'. Default: top

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBandsLabel.X
member.summary: Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisPlotBandsLabel.Y
member.summary: Vertical position of the text baseline relative to the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are 'left', 'center' and 'right'. Defaults to the same as the align option.

member.name: T:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Align
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of 'left', 'center' or 'right'. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the stack total labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter. Default: {total}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.total. Defaults to: function() { return this.total;}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Default: 0

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the label. Defaults to:style: { color: '#666', 'font-size': '11px', 'line-height': '14px'}

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.TextAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are 'left', 'center' and 'right'. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels. Default: false

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Defines the vertical alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the left of the stacked bar. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisStackLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Align
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are 'low', 'middle' or 'high'. Default: middle

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels and the title. Positive values are outside the axis line, negative are inside. Default: 40

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top. Default: 270

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable. Default: { "color": "#707070", "fontWeight": "bold" }

member.name: P:DotNet.Highstock.Options.YAxisTitle.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. Horizontal texts can contain HTML, but rotated texts are painted using vector techniques and must be clean text. The Y axis title is disabled by setting the text option to null. Default: Values
